name: Glitch for SD 2.x
description:
Glitch is a finetuned embedding inspired by 80s and 90s VHS tape aesthetics (trained on SD 2.1 768 ema pruned). With it you can style images overall and affect skin, clothing and the general appearance of people, animals and more.


Glitch generates both painted and photorealistic styles, where subjects and objects become more or less part of the VHS like glitch.

Install instructions and usage

  1. Place either the glitch.pt or glitch.png file in the embeddings folder of your Automatic1111 installation.

  2. Trigger the style in the prompt by writing glitch.

To get great results a very basic negative prompting is suggested:

ugly cartoon drawing, blurry, blurry, blurry, blurry

This negative prompt is used throughout images shown in this presentation, which is a shorter, edited version of Stability AI’s recommendation for SD 2.x. Turning on highres fix is also higly recommended to achieve the best results.

Also: DPM++ SDE Karras is your friend

meta.prompt: glitch, extreme close-up portrait of Millie Bobby Brown 80s hair, Stranger Things movie still, Arri Alexa LF, heavy grain
meta.negativePrompt: ugly cartoon drawing, blurry, blurry, blurry, blurry
